programme.title: Spider-Man: Far from Home (2019)
programme.desc: Following the events of Avengers: Endgame (2019), Spider-Man must step up to take on new threats in a world that has changed forever

programme.title: Kin (2018)
programme.desc: A retired master car thief must come back to the industry and steal fifty cars with his crew in one night to save his brother's life

programme.title: Dazed and Confused (1993)
programme.desc: The adventures of high school and junior high students on the last day of school in May 1976

programme.title: The Mask (1994)
programme.desc: Bank clerk Stanley Ipkiss is transformed into a manic superhero when he wears a mysterious mask

programme.title: The Machinist (2004)
programme.desc: An industrial worker who hasn't slept in a year begins to doubt his own sanity

programme.title: Judgment Night (1993)
programme.desc: Four friends on their way to a boxing match get caught in heavy traffic, so they take a shortcut in order to get there faster, unfortunately it leads to them witnessing a murder which leaves them running for their lives

programme.title: Léon: The Professional (1994)
programme.desc: Mathilda, a 12-year-old girl, is reluctantly taken in by Léon, a professional assassin, after her family is murdered. An unusual relationship forms as she becomes his protégée and learns the assassin's trade

programme.title: Reservoir Dogs (1992)
programme.desc: When a simple jewelry heist goes horribly wrong, the surviving criminals begin to suspect that one of them is a police informant

programme.title: The Breakfast Club (1985)
programme.desc: Five high school students meet in Saturday detention and discover how they have a lot more in common than they thought

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Charlie Stayt and Naga Munchetty present a round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather.(n)

programme.title: Daily Kitchen Live
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt and Jack Monroe are joined by a range of culinary talent from across the country by live link as they cook up another selection of dishes to inspire viewers.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: The presenters follow the development of terraced houses in Walthamstow in London and Dover in Kent, and a three-bedroom semi in the Essex town of Epping.(n)

programme.title: Night Force
programme.desc: The volunteers from Northumbria Blood Bikes who transfer life-saving supplies between hospitals, and the Northern Powergrid team tackling power cuts through the night.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Experts Kate Bliss and Ben Cooper help two teams search for items at the Newark Runway Antiques and Collectors fair in Nottinghamshire. Presented by Charlie Ross.(n)

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Ruhma struggles to cope at home and turns to the one person who cannot judge her. Emma meets a demanding pregnant patient, and the soap dispenser mystery is finally solved.(n)

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The mayor is electrocuted while speaking at the Kembleford village fete, and Father Brown suspects he was the victim of a deliberate act. Meanwhile, Mrs McCarthy's past comes back to haunt her. Mystery, starring Mark Williams and Sorcha Cusack.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton looks for property on Anglesey for a couple who have a Â£475,000 budget, and also learns about the importance of preserving the island's ancient woodland.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore scours the recycling centre in Witley, Surrey, for items that can be reclaimed and given a new life, including an old aluminium trough.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Catherine Southon and Tim Medhurst's trip takes in the Shires, where Tim shares some interesting sandwich recipes and uncovers an old coffin, while Catherine finds some medals.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Live magazine show featuring a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest. Presented by Alex Jones.(n)

programme.title: For Love or Money
programme.desc: Kym Marsh and Ashley John-Baptiste investigate a scam that saw its unwitting victim conned out of his life savings and dragged into a money-laundering ring.(n)

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the topical debate, inviting a panel of politicians and other guests to answer questions from viewers at home on subjects that have made the headlines over the past week.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The penultimate show sees the four amateurs being mentored by Albert Adria, one of the world's greatest pastry chefs. He welcomes the finalists into his Cakes and Bubbles restaurant in London's CafÃ© Royal, where he demonstrates two of his dishes, which they have to recreate for a table of world-class pastry experts. After this, the contestants have one final chance to impress, creating one exceptional dish for John Torode and Gregg Wallace that will showcase their growing cooking talent - knowing only three of them will make it through to the final show.(n)

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: With Sasha back on fighting form, UCOS investigates the death of a talented cricket prodigy, who was the apple of his father's eye, yet loathed by his on-field team-mates. The death was recorded as misadventure but with new evidence pointing to infighting, over-zealous autograph hunters and extra marital affairs, UCOS are soon bowled over by the list of potential murder suspects. Meanwhile, wise to Steve's monetary problems, Danny appoints himself as his personal financial adviser. Detective drama, starring Larry Lamb.(n)

programme.title: Newscast
programme.desc: Laura Kuenssberg, Adam Fleming and Fergus Walsh present the latest on the coronavirus pandemic.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Charlie Stayt and Naga Munchetty present a round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather.(n)

programme.title: Daily Kitchen Live
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt is joined by food writer and journalist Jack Monroe in the studio, as well as a range of culinary talent from across the country by live link. Together they cook up a range of dishes to inspire viewers at home.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martel Maxwell is in her native Scotland looking round a flat in Dumfries, as well as visiting a plot of land in Birmingham, and Martin Roberts is at a house in Abergavenny.(n)

programme.title: Night Force
programme.desc: Documentary following the lives of the army of night workers. Here, the team at one of the country's biggest shopping malls installs a three-metre tall reindeer for Christmas shoppers. In Tynemouth the biggest fish catch of the year is landed with only hours to process the catch, while refuse collectors work hard to get Newcastle's streets clean and waste recycled before dawn breaks.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp invites two teams to tour Detling Antique and Vintage Fair in Kent in search of items to take to auction in the hope of making the greater profit. They are helped on their endeavours by experts Caroline Hawley and Raj Bisram. Away from the contest, Natasha has a mystery item up her sleeve.(n)

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Rob and Karen's day off does not go to plan when a surprise visitor turns into an unwelcome guest. Shak is left reeling by Ruhma's confession, while Daniel berates Bear's lack of 'hands on' research.(n)

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The priest's priceless Blue Cross is targeted by infamous criminal Flambeau, so taking matters into his own hands Father Brown sets out to try to save the thief's soul, but risks falling into a trap. Mystery, starring Mark Williams.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin embarks on a house-hunting expedition in north Wales with a couple who have a Â£300,000 budget and a wish list including a craft room and community close by. Away from his quest, Jonnie cannot resist trying out Snowdonia's latest outdoor activity, catching a wave at the world's first artificial surf lagoon.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Junk rejuvenator Sarah Moore rummages through the rubbish at Dunbar Recycling Centre in Scotland, where she's on the lookout for three unwanted items that she can save from the skip. Sarah calls on carpenter Bruce Faulseit to add a modern twist to a collection of bathroom bits, while blacksmith Kev Paxton tries to find a creative new use for a galvanised metal sheet. For Sarah's own project she has three dining chairs to update.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Catherine Southon and Tim Medhurst explore the rolling Cotswold Hills in their 1970s off-roader. There are ancient artefacts, dry stone walls and lots and lots of sheep - but who will win out at the final auction in Devizes, Wiltshire?(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones brings the working week to a close with the usual mix of celebrity guests and stories about people in extraordinary circumstances.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: After an arduous eight-week journey, the search for the country's best amateur cook reaches its climax as the final three contenders push themselves to the limit for one last time before judges John Torode and Gregg Wallace. This is their very last chance to pull out all the stops, show everything they've learned along the way and demonstrate the kind of cook they have become. They must produce the best three dishes of their lives, push their culinary boundaries and deliver jaw-droppingly good food as they vie to lift the trophy and become the 16th MasterChef champion.(n)

programme.title: Have I Got News for You
programme.desc: Victoria Coren Mitchell hosts the satirical current affairs quiz, with entrepreneur Deborah Meaden and comedian Phil Wang joining regular team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton.(n)

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: The Bafta-award-winning host is back to review trending news stories before making online contact with guests Patrick Stewart, Ricky Gervais and Thandie Newton. Plus, more viewers recount an anecdote, desperate to avoid rejection, and there's music by Christine and the Queens.(n)

programme.title: Peter Kay's Comedy Shuffle
programme.desc: The comedian, actor, writer and director looks back over his eventful career in showbusiness, joined by rock legend Noddy Holder.(n)

programme.title: Goodness Gracious Me - 20 Years Innit
programme.desc: To celebrate its 20th anniversary, this programme looks back at some the funniest and most-loved moments from the award-winning comedy sketch show, including the 10 most memorable sketches - featuring the likes of The Kupers/Coopers, Mr Everything Comes from India, Chunky Lafunga, Cheque Please and Competitive Mums - voted for by comedy fans. The programme also features a series of exclusive interviews with stars of the show, its creators and fellow comedians who are fans of the series.(n)

programme.title: Goodness Gracious Me
programme.desc: The first-ever episode of the Asian sketch show, first aired in 1998, starring Meera Syal, Sanjeev Bhaskar, Nina Wadia and Kulvinder Ghir. Highlights include life with the Coopers, nightclubbing with the Bhangramuffins, and why brown is the new black.(n)

programme.title: The Sapphires
programme.desc: An Irish music manager discovers four Aboriginal Australian singers in a remote mission in the 1960s, and plans to turn them into their country's answer to the Supremes. The naive girls face a challenging journey to stardom when they are sent to entertain American troops in the Vietnam War. Drama, starring Deborah Mailman and Chris O'Dowd.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Charlie Stayt and Naga Munchetty present national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features. Including NewsWatch at 7.45.(n)

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt hosts the cookery show, with chef Paul A Young in the studio and special guest Stacey Dooley via videolink. Plus, highlights from the BBC Archives.(n)

programme.title: Nadiya's Family Favourites
programme.desc: Nadiya Hussain creates dishes perfect for winding down at the weekend, including spinach shakshuka, a quick and easy squid risotto, a twist on Sunday lunch and an orange and coffee poke cake. Nadiya's quest to find the best home-made marmalade in Britain takes her to Preston, where she meets 102-year-old Nora, and her penchant for a good cuppa lands her on Britain's first-ever tea plantation in Cornwall.(n)

programme.title: Football Focus
programme.desc: Dan Walker and a panel of guests discuss the latest football news.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Martel Maxwell visit a flat in Forest Hill, London, and a terraced houses Nantwich, Cheshire, before speaking to their new owners.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Charlie Ross hosts from Ardingly Antiques Fair, West Sussex, where a father and son compete against a mother and son. Tim Weeks leads the red team, while Charles Hanson takes charge of the blues. Away from the contest, Charlie meets a record breaker with an amazing collection of Monopoly boards that cost Â£250,000.(n)

programme.title: FA Cup Football
programme.desc: A look back at the memorable 1990 semi-finals, as Liverpool faced Crystal Palace and Manchester United took on Oldham Athletic. Liverpool and United were expected to reach the final, but the underdogs in each tie helped to produce a day of enthralling drama. Presented by Guy Mowbray.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore is in Surrey, checking out the cast-offs at Witley Recycling Centre, where she comes across a drum kit to repurpose.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman helps a woman and her niece to search for a house in rural Gloucestershire, and also visits Owlpen Manor to find out how the Tudor property was rescued.(n)

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Rich brothers David and Harry together with Arit Anderson travel to the West Midlands to help Richard and Darren create their very own slice of New York's 'High Line' garden in Solihull. The New York garden has famously turned an old disused, overground train line into a thriving garden that mixes contemporary paving, grass planting and historical, leftover train tracks. The couple want this garden to remind them of their honeymoon in the Big Apple.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman presents a very special episode featuring a collection of bloopers, out-takes and unforgettable moments from the show over the past ten years, including classic nonsensical answers, exciting big wins, and a glimpse behind the curtain at parts of the show never seen before.(n)

programme.title: Celebrity Mastermind
programme.desc: Scissor Sisters singer Ana Matronic, The Inbetweeners star Joe Thomas, former rugby union player Maggie Alphonsi and restaurant critic Jay Rayner answer questions on the specialist subjects of The Bionic Woman, George Orwell, Denise Lewis and the film musicals of Arthur Freed. Host John Humphrys then puts their general knowledge to the test before winner is announced.(n)

programme.title: Catchpoint
programme.desc: Paddy McGuinness hosts a family-friendly game show combining physical fun and an exciting question mechanic, as contestants have to think fast as they answer questions while trying to catch balls of various sizes dropped from the studio ceiling, with a variety of entertaining rounds and a cash prize at stake.(n)

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Hospital drama with the staff of Holby's accident and emergency department as they deal with more sick and injured patients. Still feeling conflicted about his feelings, Dylan tries to avoid Faith as much as possible. Meanwhile, Rash goes against Connie's wishes when dealing with a challenging patient, and Ruby makes a life changing decision.(n)

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: The couple announce their engagement, prompting the Shipmans to throw a party in Billericay. Even Bryn's decision to use his sat-nav for the journey fails to dampen their spirits, and everything goes swimmingly until the conversation turns to money - and the sweethearts drop a bombshell. Mathew Horne and Joanna Page star.(n)

programme.title: Outnumbered
programme.desc: Ben's school parents' evening takes an unexpected turn when he begins discussing muggers, dangerous chemicals and re-enactments of the Great Plague. Karen tries to decide which religion she would like to lead, while Sue still believes Jake is hiding something. Comedy, starring Daniel Roche and Ramona Marquez.(n)

programme.title: All Round to Mrs Brown's
programme.desc: Mrs Brown's Boys creator, writer and star Brendan O'Carroll dons Agnes's famous cardigan and curly wig once again as he throws open the doors of the larger-than-life Irish matriarch's home to host the Saturday night chat show. In the fifth episode of the series, Agnes and his comical family are joined on the show by the comedian and The Masked Singer host Joel Dommett, and morning television presenters Ruth Langsford and Eamonn Holmes. Plus, British country duo The Shires perform live on the show.(n)

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker is joined by Alan Shearer and Ian Wright to discuss the top 10 players in Premier League history for a chosen category.(n)

programme.title: Match of Their Day
programme.desc: Highlights from three classic Premier League matches, as chosen by some of the regular expert analysts that appear on the show. Gary Lineker presents, with Alan Shearer and Ian Wright.(n)

programme.title: The Damned United
programme.desc: Fact-based drama chronicling Brian Clough's ill-fated 44-day tenure as boss of Leeds United in 1974, after Don Revie's departure for the job of England's manager. Following his acrimonious split from Derby County and a brief spell at Brighton & Hove Albion, Clough arrived at Elland Road on a wave of controversy, after previously being an outspoken critic of the club, and struggled to find allies among the playing staff. With Michael Sheen, Timothy Spall, Jim Broadbent and Colm Meaney.(n)

programme.title: Night Force
programme.desc: Documentary following the lives of the army of night workers who toil through the small hours to get the world ready for when the rest of the population awakes.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the team return for a second visit to Morden Hall Park in South London, where items include letters written by Mother Teresa and a bronze by South African sculptor Anton Van Wouw. There is also a colourful collage by celebrated British artist and illustrator John Minton, and a huge collection of intricately designed silver vinaigrette boxes.(n)

programme.title: Lambing Live
programme.desc: Kate Humble meets a very different kind of sheepdog, while Adam Henson learns there is much more to grass than meets the eye. Plus, a chance to catch up with all the lambs born today at the Dykes' family farm in the Scottish Borders.(n)

programme.title: Curiosity
programme.desc: Sir Duke and Jeremy from the West Midlands are among the contestants taking part in the antiques game show to curate the most valuable collection, with Â£1,000 going to the winners.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Those Magnificent Men in Their Flying Machines
programme.desc: A publisher offers to sponsor the first London-to-Paris air race in a bid to boost the sales of his newspaper. Among the motley assortment of characters who sign up for the challenge is a scheming nobleman bent on sabotaging the efforts of the other entrants. Period comedy, starring Terry-Thomas, Sarah Miles, James Fox, Robert Morley, Benny Hill, Tony Hancock, Eric Sykes and Gert Frobe.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Catherine Southon and Nick Hall assess items brought to Boconnoc House in Cornwall, while presenter Paul martin participates in a traditional Cornish gig race.(n)

programme.title: My Life on a Plate
programme.desc: Chef Brian Turner takes guests back to their youths by visiting locations important to them and then cooking dishes inspired by their childhoods. In the first edition he is joined by cookery writer and former Great British Bake Off judge Mary Berry.(n)

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Countdown mathematician Rachel Riley, singer JB Gill, newscaster Katie Derham and comedian Richard Herring compete to see who can master the tasks set by Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: The vets operate on Violet the koala to investigate her breathing problems, and the keepers wonder which will come off worst when a tree porcupine comes face to face with a skunk.(n)

programme.title: The Lakes with Paul Rose
programme.desc: The explorer digs out his rucksack and heads for Windermere in the Lake District. The National Park attracts 18 million visitors each year, and is now a World Heritage site. Here, Paul finds out why the early tourists thought the Lakes was one of the most dangerous spots in the country. He also plunges into the world of long-distance swimming and helps the staff who run the boats on the lake and meets a Holocaust survivor who was airlifted to Windermere in 1945 as part of a mercy mission involving 300 orphans after the Second World War.(n)

programme.title: Grand Tours of Scotland's Lochs
programme.desc: Paul Murton travels from the shores of Loch Hope to the lonely expanse of Sandwood Bay in the far north-west. Along the way he discovers wartime secrets in Loch Eriboll, crosses a subterranean loch and learns the art of drystone dyking from a master craftsman in Kinlochbervie.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs from the North West cook mains and desserts celebrating children's literature, and while one takes inspiration from JM Barrie and his own imaginary feast, the other two choose Beatrix Potter, leaving judge Michael O'Hare to decide which lamb dish is better.(n)

programme.title: Devs
programme.desc: Lily's investigation leads her to the man who knows Sergei's secrets, and stirs suspicion about her employer, Forest. But when he tries to throw her off the scent, she becomes more driven to find answers, and turns again to Jamie - although he is concerned how she will act upon whatever he finds. Mystery thriller, starring Sonoya Mizuno, Nick Offerman, Zach Grenier and Alison Pill.(n)

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.desc: Sindhu Vee hosts this episode of the comedy showcase recorded before a packed house at London's Hammersmith Apollo, featuring stand-up performances by New York-based Edinburgh comedy award winner Alex Edelman, and at the Edinburgh Festival Fringe Comedians' Choice Award winner Lou Sanders.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Kirsty Wark.(n)

programme.title: Front Row Late
programme.desc: Host Mary Beard gets to grips with the latest broadcast technology as she aims to present the latest series of the arts review show from her study each week. And with cultural institutions around the country closed, the programme aims to bring content alive through interviews, discussions and exclusive performances from leading writers, artists, actors and musicians. The first show features an exclusive puppet production based on a short story by Edgar Allan Poe, created in confinement in Canada by leading author Margaret Atwood and her sister Ruth.(n)

programme.title: Villages by the Sea
programme.desc: Archaeologist Ben Robinson examines the history of the Lancashire village Sunderland Point, which is cut off twice a day by the tide and has become a haven for wildlife. He reveals it was once a busy port that was instrumental in the slave trade, and at the forefront of the luxury goods business that transformed 18th-century Britain..(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: Six heat winners return for the quarter-final, fighting for a place in Knockout Week. Facing the Critic's Test, the week's best-performing amateurs take on an intimidating task - cooking to a brief set by food writer Jimi Famurewa, who asks for a dish inspired by flavours of the sweet shop. Presented by John Torode and Gregg Wallace.(n)

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers' Mediterranean Adventure
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers explore the culinary delights of Sardinia, starting out in Cagliari, where everyone is in high spirits for the feast of St Efisio. The bikers join in by cooking a local speciality, almond and orange cakes. They also meet the tuna fishermen of Carloforte and a chef who has a special way of serving up platters of the fish, are shown how to make sheep's black pudding by a group of shepherds and are served a stew by the 'King of Sardinia'.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Night Force
programme.desc: Documentary following the lives of the army of night workers who toil through the small hours to get the world ready for when the rest of the population awakes.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: Back in Time for..
programme.desc: The Arderns reflect on the lessons learned through the series, and how corner shops can continue to thrive in the changing world of 21st-century business. The programme examines how shops have reinvented themselves to compete with mini-supermarkets, the rise of zero-waste shops, and how other businesses, like cafes, coffee shops and micro pubs, are filling the role of community hub.(n)

programme.title: Lambing Live
programme.desc: As the week of broadcasts from the Dykes' family farm in the Scottish Borders draws to a close, Kate Humble learns about the dedication and attention to detail it takes to raise lambs for their meat. Adam Henson looks at the future of breeding as he encounters some test-tube sheep, and there is a last update about the new arrivals in the lambing sheds.(n)

programme.title: Curiosity
programme.desc: Paul and Lin from Dorset take on Anne-Marie and Morgan from Nottingham in an antiques challenge to curate the most valuable collection. Presented by Paul Martin.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Best Bakes Ever
programme.desc: Actress and cake expert Jane Asher presents another selection of recipes from TV chefs, including the likes of James Martin, Mary Berry, Paul Hollywood, the Hairy Bikers, Raymond Blanc, Nigella Lawson, Tom Kerridge, Lorraine Pascale and Rachel Khoo.(n)

programme.title: Swallows and Amazons
programme.desc: Four youngsters go boating while on holiday in the Lake District where they encounter two more children with a boat of their own, and a rivalry develops over a series of escapades. Family adventure, based on Arthur Ransome's classic novel, starring Virginia McKenna, Ronald Fraser, Sophie Neville and Simon West.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: At Oxburgh Hall in Norfolk, David Harper is excited by a Polynesian war club, while Philip Serrell falls for a sewing machine dating back to 1875. Presenter Paul Martin uncovers the history of the Bedingfeld family, whose members have called Oxburgh home for 500 years - and managed to keep their heads on their shoulders.(n)

programme.title: My Life on a Plate
programme.desc: Brian Turner discusses culinary memories with Anneka Rice, revisiting her childhood in Surrey, and creates two dishes that take her back to that time.(n)

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Mathematician Rachel Riley, singer and farmer JB Gill, radio presenter Katie Derham and comedian Richard Herring test their general knowledge skills, with an overall champion being crowned for the week.(n)

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: After weeks of speculation, Kate Humble and Ben Fogle reveal that the signs are that rare Amur tiger Yana is definitely pregnant. Anxious not to miss the historic birth of cubs - the first at the Park for nearly 20 years - keepers install special cameras in the Tiger House, which will also enable them to closely monitor Yana's heath at a safe distance. Plus, Jean Johansson discovers why coconuts are just the job for the dental health of Cape Porcupines.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's Secret France
programme.desc: The chef concludes his tour with trips to the Languedoc and Provence. In the border town of Uzes, Rick samples salt cod and marvels at a colourful array of French patisserie - selecting a seasonal fig tart to have with his morning coffee. He moves on to the harbour town of Cassis to try North African lamb chorba cooked by a local fisherman, while back in his country kitchen, he prepares a confit tomato and aubergine tarte tatin.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The green-fingered team guides team enthusiasts through seasonal highlights from across the country visiting stunning gardens, meeting the gardeners and finding out their secrets of success. Monty Don and faithful hounds Nigel and Nellie are at Longmeadow to bring inspiration as well as outline all the essential gardening jobs for this weekend. Co-presented by Joe Swift.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two highest scoring chefs from the North West go head to head to cook their six-course menus again. Not only do they need to impress food writer Matthew Fort, restaurateur Oliver Peyton and broadcaster and cook Andi Oliver, but also bestselling children's author and Laureate between 2011 and 2013 Julia Donaldson, who has sold over 65 million books worldwide and been translated into over 75 languages. Presented by Susan Calman.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: Documentary examining attempts to save the most illegally trafficked animals in the world - a little-known scaly mammal called the pangolin. Based in Namibia, conservationist Maria Diekmann rescues and rehabilitates these local creatures. Cameras follow her to Vietnam, Thailand and China - into the heart of the crisis, where demand for pangolin products is greatest.(n)

programme.title: The Mash Report
programme.desc: A self-isolated Nish Kumar hosts Britain's most uncompromising topical satire, tackling all the troubling news from a world that's put its faith in Boris Johnson and Donald Trump. His similarly quarantined correspondents, include Ellie Taylor and Steve N Allen.(n)

programme.title: The Mini Mash Report
programme.desc: Nish Kumar and comedy correspondents Rachel Parris, Ellie Taylor and Steve N Allen present the satirical and surreal take on everything that happened in the week the programme first aired in May 2019.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, with Kirsty Wark.(n)

programme.title: Cold in July
programme.desc: A small-town man is hailed as a hero after he shoots dead a burglar who had broken into his home. He begins to fear for his life when the thief's father turns up seeking revenge, which is only the first in a series of events that plunge his simple life into chaos. Crime thriller based on Joe R Lansdale's novel, starring Michael C Hall, Sam Shepard and Don Johnson.(n)

programme.title: Cops Like Us
programme.desc: Documentary following Staffordshire Police officers, who talk candidly about the frustrations of being on the beat in Stoke-on-Trent, one of the UK's most deprived cities. Filmed over six months, the series captures emergency response teams trying to combat a backlog of cases, as well as a rise in gang culture, hate crime and domestic violence. Interviews with the Chief Constable and his team also reveal how they manage their limited resources, and how they feel about the decisions they have to make.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The green-fingered team guides team enthusiasts through seasonal highlights from across the country visiting stunning gardens, meeting the gardeners and finding out their secrets of success. Monty Don and faithful hounds Nigel and Nellie are at Longmeadow to bring inspiration as well as outline all the essential gardening jobs for this weekend. Co-presented by Joe Swift.(n)

programme.title: All Over the Place
programme.desc: Ed Petrie goes on an offbeat road trip across the UK.(n)

programme.title: The Dengineers
programme.desc: Joe Tracini and Meryl Fernandes enlist expert designers and builders to construct dream dens for lucky youngsters.(n)

programme.title: Blue Peter
programme.desc: Long-running children's magazine programme.(n)

programme.title: Deadly 60
programme.desc: Steve Backshall and the team return to Mexico to search for more dangerous creatures, including a crocodile with a nasty bite and one of the world's most vicious sharks.(n)

programme.title: Deadly 60
programme.desc: Steve Backshall explores dangerous fauna in Venezuela, including green anacondas, vampire bats and scolopendras - giant venomous centipedes.(n)

programme.title: Astronauts: Do You Have What It Takes
programme.desc: The remaining candidates are put through more demanding tests by astronaut Chris Hadfield and his expert panel, with some pushed to their limits in a simulated emergency splashdown, where they have to escape from an underwater capsule. At one of the UK's biggest space-tech firms, they must successfully operate the Mars Rover, while a social event gives Chris, Kevin Fong and Iya Whiteley a further chance to scrutinise their characters.(n)

programme.title: Operation Wild
programme.desc: Broadcaster Clare Balding and vet Steve Leonard travel the world to watch vets perform innovative life-saving operations on a variety of wild animals. This first edition features a baby panda called Zhu Xia in south-west China in need of an MRI scan, and rescued gorilla Shufai in Cameroon, who was shot by poachers when he was a baby. Plus, a manta ray on the Japanese island of Okinawa is given an ultra-sound scan to determine if it's pregnant, and a four-ton elephant in Laos with a gunshot wound.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: As the competition continues, chefs Tom Barnes, Sam Buckley, Hrishikesh Desai and George Farrugia compete in the heats for the North West. Each chef prepares a starter and fish course celebrating iconic food from children's literature, specifically tasked with honouring the theme of action and adventure. Presented by Susan Calman.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs from the North West cook mains and desserts celebrating children's literature, and while one takes inspiration from JM Barrie and his own imaginary feast, the other two choose Beatrix Potter, leaving judge Michael O'Hare to decide which lamb dish is better.(n)

programme.title: The Â£100K House: Tricks of the Trade
programme.desc: Desperate to continue living in London, Adam bought one of the thinnest homes in the country. However, at six foot wide in places, the former alleyway was dark and barely habitable. Architect Katy Marks helps to transform his home with radical ideas, and Piers Taylor demonstrates how lighting, furniture and colours can make all the difference. Meanwhile, in Walsall, Hardeep and Rupinder have plenty of room for their family, but in all the wrong places. Piers Taylor designs them the ultimate social space, and encourages them to orientate their home around the garden.(n)

programme.title: World Snooker: Crucible Classics
programme.desc: Steve Davis v Tony Knowles. Hazel Irvine introduces action from the first-round match at the 1982 World Championship, staged at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield.(n)

programme.title: Talking Snooker
programme.desc: Alistair McGowan takes an affectionate look at the lives and careers of Alex Higgins, Jimmy White and Ronnie O'Sullivan, three of snooker's biggest stars. He examines the early TV appearances that captured each of them before they hit the big time, and charts the ups and downs of their respective careers, in an effort to capture a sense of why they were all known as the people's champion.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Cellmates Fletcher and Godber are coerced into aiding an escape attempt organised by the sinister Grouty. However, the two jailbirds contrive to break back into prison before their absence is detected by the formidable Mr Mackay. Comedy based on the TV series, starring Ronnie Barker, Richard Beckinsale, Peter Vaughan, Fulton Mackay and Brian Wilde.(n)

programme.title: The Many Faces of
programme.desc: The story of a quiet, dedicated man who might have been a bank manager, but went on to become one of the nation's most popular comedy stars. Ben Elton, Michael Grade, David Renwick and Josephine Tewson are among friends and colleagues who remember his partnership with Ronnie Corbett in sketch show The Two Ronnies, as skinflint grocer Arkwright in Open All Hours and crafty prisoner Fletch in Porridge. There is also a look at his prolific writing career and his work as an actor in serious roles.(n)

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo visits the Thai capital of Bangkok, where he learns how the late 19th-century King Rama V built a grand palace and introduced railways to the country. Michael also learns that King Rama V's love of steam engines was inspired by Queen Victoria. Moving on, the presenter also confronts his fear of snakes to assist in a surgical operation on a venomous king cobra and steps into the ring to learn Muay Thai boxing.(n)

programme.title: The Sense of an Ending
programme.desc: Divorced and retired, aging Londoner and vintage camera shop owner Tony Webster whittles down the solitude of his isolated existence by keeping an affectionate relationship with his ex-wife, Margaret, and by accompanying his pregnant daughter, Susie, to antenatal courses. However, the unexpected arrival of an unsettling letter disrupts the fine balance of things in Tony's orderly life, reconnecting him with his first love from college, Veronica, and the nostalgic, yet clouded memories of a distant past. Drama, starring Jim Broadbent, Charlotte Rampling and Harriet Walter.(n)

programme.title: The Conversation
programme.desc: An obsessive, paranoid electronic surveillance expert - renowned within the profession as being the best - makes the unprofessional mistake of getting personally involved in a dangerous case on his San Francisco patch. Francis Ford Coppola's thriller, starring Gene Hackman, John Cazale, Robert Duvall, Allen Garfield and Harrison Ford.(n)

programme.title: The Sky at Night
programme.desc: How ESA's Solar Orbiter was built, how it will protect itself against the Sun's searing heat and how it will investigate the mysteries of the Sun. Presented by Chris Lintott and Pete Lawrence.(n)

programme.title: How to Make
programme.desc: Designer Zoe Laughlin sets out to redesign audio headphones, an intimate item that transport the wearer to another place. In search of inspiration she heads to Hull University to discover a new substance that can turn any surface into a speaker - from a wall to a table and even the bone of a skull. Zoe also looks at the device's history, from the stethoscope-style home contraptions of the 19th century and the game-changing 1980s Sony Walkman. But what will she come up with in her own design?(n)

programme.title: Mark Kermode's Secrets of Cinema
programme.desc: The critic examines techniques and conventions behind the heist movie, from The Asphalt Jungle and Oceans Eleven to The Italian Job and Baby Driver. He also reveals why this genre plays with peoples' sympathies more than any other.(n)

programme.title: Secrets of Silicon Valley
programme.desc: Part one of two. Jamie Bartlett investigates how technology companies are shaping the future of the world, and the potential negative consequences of the drive towards progress. He visits Hyderabad, where the utopian vision promoted by Uber has left many drivers on the brink of suicide, questions the impact of more jobs becoming automated, and meets a former executive who fears social breakdown and the collapse of capitalism.(n)

programme.title: From Ice to Fire: The Incredible Science of Temperature
programme.desc: Helen Czerski explores the science of heat, and how the ability to harness it has led to some of humanity's greatest innovations, from steam engines to plasmas.(n)

programme.title: The No 5 War
programme.desc: The story, both thrilling and dark, of the world's most famous perfume. In 1921, Coco Chanel's revolutionary perfume concept was as audacious as her outlandish designer clothing. At its launch it was an instant hit. From the 1920s to the 1940s the Number 5 brand was at the centre of a war between the celebrated designer and her entrepreneurial business partners, the Wertheimer Brothers. During the Second World War, with the help of her high-ranking Nazi lover, Coco Chanel attempted to oust her Jewish partners - who had fled German occupied France and were operating the business from New Jersey - to take control of the highly lucrative business.(n)

programme.title: England's Reformation: Three Books That Changed a Nation
programme.desc: To mark the 500th anniversary of the Reformation, Janina Ramirez tells the story of three books that defined this radical religious revolution in England. Tyndale's New Testament made the word of God accessible to the common man for the first time, The Book of Common Prayer established the Protestant religion, and Foxe's Book of Martyrs enshrined a hatred of Catholicism. Janina discovers how together, this trio of texts had a powerful cumulative effect.(n)

programme.title: Mark Kermode's Secrets of Cinema
programme.desc: The critic examines techniques and conventions behind the heist movie, from The Asphalt Jungle and Oceans Eleven to The Italian Job and Baby Driver. He also reveals why this genre plays with peoples' sympathies more than any other.(n)

programme.title: How to Make
programme.desc: Designer Zoe Laughlin sets out to redesign audio headphones, an intimate item that transport the wearer to another place. In search of inspiration she heads to Hull University to discover a new substance that can turn any surface into a speaker - from a wall to a table and even the bone of a skull. Zoe also looks at the device's history, from the stethoscope-style home contraptions of the 19th century and the game-changing 1980s Sony Walkman. But what will she come up with in her own design?(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1989
programme.desc: Bruno Brookes and Jackie Brambles host the edition first shown on July 13, featuring performances by Waterfront, Bette Midler, De La Soul, Danny Wilson, Michael Jackson, Kirsty MacColl and Gloria Estefan.(n)

programme.title: How Pop Songs Work
programme.desc: Charles Hazlewood explores what makes a good pop single, breaking the songs down into six key areas - melody, song structure, lyrics, production arrangement and performance - before looking at successful songs in the genre. The conductor uses successful albums from the genre including John Lennon's Imagine and Amy Winehouse's Back to Black to examine these categories. Contributors include songwriter Guy Chambers, ABC singer Martin Fry and producers Steve Levine and Richard Niles.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1989
programme.desc: Gary Davies hosts the edition first shown on July 20, featuring performances by Sonia, London Boys, the Cult, Bobby Brown, Jive Bunny and the Mastermixers, Eartha Kitt and Bronski Beat, and Monie Love.(n)

programme.title: Sounds of the 70s 2
programme.desc: The rock 'n' roll revivalism and 1950s retro leanings present in much of the decade's music, including glam and AOR. Featuring tracks by ELO, T.Rex, 10cc, Alvin Stardust and Mott the Hoople, culminating in Meat Loaf's 1978 Old Grey Whistle Test performance of Paradise by the Dashboard Light.(n)

programme.title: Elvis: The Rebirth of the King
programme.desc: When Elvis Presley began performing in Las Vegas in 1969, many believed that was the end of his career, especially after the excitement of his '68 Comeback Special. This documentary follows his time in the gambling capital and argues that it was a musical renaissance for the King, who reached his peak as both as a singer and performer - jumpsuits and all.(n)

programme.title: Sinatra: All or Nothing at All
programme.desc: Up-close and personal examination of the life, music and career of legendary entertainer Frank Sinatra, told in his own words from hours of archived interviews, along with commentary from those closest to him. Featuring previously unseen footage from home movies and concert performances, including his legendary 1971 'retirement concert' in Los Angeles, this tribute to the showman follows Sinatra's growth from roadhouse performer to global singing sensation.(n)

programme.title: Gregory Porter's Popular Voices
programme.desc: The soul and jazz performer explores the soft, intimate art of crooning. Born with the arrival of the microphone in the 1930s, crooning was initially about men seducing women and thrived through signature stars such as Bing Crosby, Nat King Cole and Frank Sinatra. However, far from disappearing with the advent of rock 'n' roll, the art of crooning gained a new existential edge and was transformed by the likes of Roy Orbison, David Bowie and even Lana Del Rey into a haunting and abiding strain of contemporary pop. Contributors include Iggy Pop, Joshua Homme, George Benson and Beck.(n)

programme.title: Music Moguls: Masters of Pop
programme.desc: Leading publicist Alan Edwards narrates this instalment looking at the PR plots that have helped shape some of the world's greatest artists. With the aid of rare archive footage, he explains how he and fellow exponents, such as Barbara Charone and Andy Saunders, cultivate new bands, manage crises and attempt to maintain the reputation of their long-standing clients. The programme highlights the campaigns behind superstars including Jimi Hendrix, Taylor Swift and David Bowie.(n)

programme.title: Elvis: The Rebirth of the King

This documentary follows his time in the gambling capital and argues that it was a musical renaissance for the King, who reached his peak as both as a singer and performer - jumpsuits and all.(n)

The conductor uses successful albums from the genre including John Lennon's Imagine and Amy Winehouse's Back to Black to examine these categories. Contributors include songwriter Guy Chambers, ABC singer Martin Fry and producers Steve Levine and Richard Niles.(n)

programme.title: The Private Life of..
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty reveals the hidden lives of farmyard animals, beginning with an investigation into the nature of cows. Visiting Devon and Northumberland, he discovers how the hierarchy of a herd is established, tests their intelligence by trying to teach three animals how to demand food using a bell, and discovers what could turn a placid creature into a potential killer.(n)

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: Neil Oliver and Tessa Dunlop present a guide to England's south coast from Brighton to Chesil, revealing what makes these two pebble beaches special. Neil also takes a trip on a flotilla of boats that includes a prototype yacht being prepared for the America's Cup, a vessel designed to help save the Solent oyster population and an offshore powerboat. Plus, a round-up of the best Coast stories from the past 10 years.(n)

programme.title: Twin

Karin struggles at school, but when Erik tries to play the role of a dedicated father, he only reinforces her suspicion that something is seriously wrong and she decides to take matters into her own hands. In Norwegian.(n)

Dr Chris tries to solve a crime with the help of medical science and a Forensics expert, and there are more medical mysteries solved as Ouch & About On Call hits the hospital wards. Meanwhile in Accident & Emergency one patient comes in after falling on her wrist, and another has a rubber stuck in his ear.(n)

programme.desc: Following some of the UK's most promising young gymnasts. Finn and Kirsten compete for a world Acro title whilst Ekraj meets a very special coach..(n)
